text: Johanne Walhorn (born February 19, 1911 in Düsseldorf, died May 24, 1995 in Ischia) was a German lawyer and the third woman in the city of Münster history to be awarded the for her services to the city.Deutscher Juristinnenbund "Aktuelle Informationen für Juristinnen, Volks- und Betriebswirtinnen" Nr. 2, Juni 1995, Being active in social life, she managed to work in 23 committees of Münster, re-established the in Münster, was chairwoman of the district group of the Hausfrauenverein Münster, in 1951, initiated the "meat strike",Frauenorganisationen in Münster im Wandel der Zeit 1950-2000 von Marianne Hopmann, Ed. AMF Münster, 2000 built up the Kreiskreis Münster of the German Joint Welfare Association,Münsterscher Anzeiger vom 25. Februar 1991 played a great role in establishing Consumer Advice Center, in 1990, she founded the regional group Westphalia of the German Lawyer's Association. ==References== Category:1911 births Category:1995 deaths Category:German women lawyers Category:People from Münster Category:20th-century German lawyers Category:Recipients of the Cross of the Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany Category:20th-century women lawyers
title: Johanne Walhorn
